message: sooo, 4.5 months or so
I joined on October 6th, and I'm like user #6 or something.
Just curious roughly how long the 3 of you have been working on this project? How long does it take 3 very experienced Django developers to build a product like this?
convore is made using django?
I remember someone telling me it was ruby.
do you have a page which details all the technologies you've used?
@X42 huh, curious why they use the admin ..
Django https://convore.com/admin/
@dhruvbird https://convore.com/hacker-news/ask-us-convore-developers-anything/52359/
@rasiel why wouldn't they use the admin?

@pewpewarrows from my experience, when working with large databases/datasets teh default crud models of the admin are not very responsive, e.g a dropdown (fk) of users ... unless of course they use a custom admin
@rasiel well at some point that's going to happen when your data grows too large
yeah I woudln't put it past @ericflo and crew
@pewpewarrows i'm pretty sure they've done something custom, they're awesome like that
i feel like there's a scroll lag for some reason
might be related
maybe i'll migrate back to safari
like both
Haha, nothing custom quite yet, but we might need to do that eventually.
yeah, that's exactly what it is.
I can't figure out why but convore is really slow for me
i have a habit of having 5+ convore tabs open though
idk chrome in general just seems super slow lately
I'm blaming chrome
@kennethlove Like the frame rate, or the request/response times?
the scrolling is a bit choppy for some reason
Oh, and number of new users registered per day
not sure of the right topic, but @ericflo, I was wondering what kind of metrics you guys are collecting, and how?

@steveivy We're basically logging everything, so at some point we can load that up into a hadoop cluster and do queries on it.  But other than that we have graphs that shows us the number of users who viewed the site per day, the number of messages per day and per hour, the number of active groups, etc.
@ericflo nice. I'm going to stand up Grpahite for a project soon, and I've started thinking about what sort of metrics to capture.
having same problem as @steveivy

@rasiel the admin can be configured to show a text input with the pk of the related object rahter than a dropdown: http://docs.djangoproject.com/en/1.2/ref/contrib/admin/#django.contrib.admin.ModelAdmin.raw_id_fields
